title: [Massive] Digital Science Project: Deepening Collaborative Scientific Problem-Solving and Inquiry Processes Through Online Discussions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific terminology, understanding of scientific inquiry methods (observation, hypothesis, experimental design, data analysis), and digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Enhanced interaction through online discussion forums while conducting science projects in digital learning environments, sharing processes of experimental design, data measurement/analysis, and conclusion drawing. Particularly emphasizes variable control and evidence collection to foster scientific rigor.

learning_goals: Learners post opinions on hypothesis formulation and experiment design for science projects at least three times in a digital discussion forum, specifying variable control and measurement methods.
Learners provide constructive feedback—including evidence-based analysis and scientific validity—on peers’ posts five or more times.

Learners select five or more ideas from ten collected in a discussion forum, apply the scientific inquiry process (problem definition → hypothesis formulation → variable control → experiment design → data analysis → conclusion derivation), and complete a five-page A4 project report and presentation materials within a week, meeting four or more of six evaluation criteria.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
